channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Sheikh Hasina’s extradition and more: Can India-Bangladesh ties be repaired?
A real-life K-drama: The looming succession battle between Kim Jong-un’s daughter and sister
AI Impact Summit clashes CBSE board exams: What to know if you are travelling in Delhi
Did Russia use a dart frog toxin to kill Alexei Navalny? How deadly is this poison?
Explained: The key takeaways from the Munich Security Conference
Hardly ate; wore bathrobes to class... How final days of Indian student found dead in US unfolded
How Jamaat’s rise on Bangladesh border heightens India’s eastern frontier risks
item.description: The 2026 election has delivered a national partner in Tarique Rahman’s BNP, but it has also entrenched a hardened ideological adversary directly across the border from India’s most sensitive states

item.title: A strategic reset: Japan Inc bets bigger on India amid global uncertainty
item.description: The 2025 Japan Bank of International Cooperation survey ranked India first for the fourth straight year in manufacturing and, for the second consecutive year, in non-manufacturing, with over 60 per cent of respondents backing it

item.title: From vision to action: How India is leading the AI impact movement
item.description: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 will serve as a defining moment in global technology governance, representing the first major artificial intelligence summit hosted in the Global South

item.title: Social media addiction is real and dangerous
item.description: When a 62-year-old goes into withdrawal over Instagram, it’s time we confronted an uncomfortable truth: Social media is no longer harmless entertainment

item.title: India-Bangladesh ties stand at a crossroads: Cautious optimism must translate into an enduring bond
item.description: Despite the tensions, structural interdependence endures in India-Bangladesh ties. Nearly 4,000 kilometres of shared border bind the two nations economically and culturally

item.title: How China’s demographic debacle serves as a lesson for India
item.description: India’s choice to avoid coercion and respect women’s reproductive freedom not only preserves social stability but also leverages the natural benefits of an educated population
